Message: Remove language service dependency on TextDocuments (#742)
Description: The code actions API depends on TextDocuments. This is specific to the language server. This makes it hard to use without a language server. The use of TextDocuments has been removed. Instead, the resolved text document is passed down.
Message Abstract: Remove language service dependency on TextDocuments (#742)
Description Abstract: The code actions API depends on TextDocuments. This is specific to the language server. This makes it hard to use without a language server. The use of TextDocuments has been removed. Instead, the resolved text document is passed down.

Description: TypeScript was complaining about some syntax features, this solves it. It doesn’t affect the output, as tsdx ignores the target property.
Description Abstract: TypeScript was complaining about some syntax features, this solves it. It doesn’t affect the output, as tsdx ignores the target property.

Description: tsdx uses .browserslistrc to determine how to transpile the source code. By default it supports very old environments. By specifying relatively modern targets, the bundle size has been reduced with ~40%. This also significantly increases performance and readability of the output, because babel’s regenerator runtime isn’t used anymore. The output target can’t be set to something too new, because tsdx uses an older version of terser which isn’t compatible with all new syntax (e.g. optional chaining).
Description Abstract: tsdx uses .browserslistrc to determine how to transpile the source code. By default it supports very old environments. By specifying relatively modern targets, the bundle size has been reduced with ~40%. This also significantly increases performance and readability of the output, because babel’s regenerator runtime isn’t used anymore. The output target can’t be set to something too new, because tsdx uses an older version of terser which isn’t compatible with all new syntax (e.g. optional chaining).

Message: Convert dlv require statements to imports (#521)
Description: It was already imported in one place, that appears to work fine. Using require results in invalid ESM output, because require is not defined in ES modules.
Message Abstract: Convert dlv require statements to imports (#521)
Description Abstract: It was already imported in one place, that appears to work fine. Using require results in invalid ESM output, because require is not defined in ES modules.

Description: Pass validateConfigPath if a type of value equals to function. The purpose of this commit is to avoid unwanted warnings when we define theme values as functions in tailwind.config.js, which, for example, are required to define theme colors with opacity enabled. https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/discussions/2206#discussioncomment-60081
Description Abstract: Pass validateConfigPath if a type of value equals to function. The purpose of this commit is to avoid unwanted warnings when we define theme values as functions in tailwind.config.js, which, for example, are required to define theme colors with opacity enabled. link
